N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 484.1 - Fees and charges in connection with mortgage financing

State Regulations
(a) An eligible borrower which has obtained a
mortgage loan from the New York State Housing Finance Agency under the
provisions of title 5-A of article 6 of the Social Services Law, or a community
senior citizens center and services company which has obtained a mortgage loan
from the New York State Housing Finance Agency under the provisions of article
VII-A of the Private Housing Finance Law to finance all or any part of a youth
facilities project or senior citizens center project shall pay the charges due
the department in accordance with this Part to cover the reasonable costs of
services rendered by the department, including inspection, regulation, supervision and audit. (b) For the
purposes of this Part: (1)

Development period
is the period commencing as of the date of the inception of the project and
terminating as of the date of occupancy. (2)

Operational period is the period
commencing as of the date of occupancy and terminating as of the date the
mortgage is paid. (3)

Occupancy
date shall mean the occupancy date as such date is defined in the
mortgage. (c) The charge
for services rendered during the development period shall be one percent of the
mortgage loan as of the date of the mortgage closing. Such charge shall be
payable to the department by the eligible borrower upon requisition on or after
the closing of said mortgage. (d) The charge for services rendered during the operational period shall be one and
one-half tenths of one percent per annum of the amount of the mortgage loan as
of the occupancy date. Such charge shall be payable monthly to the Department
of Social Services by the eligible borrower on the first day of the month
following the aforesaid occupancy date and on the first day of each and every
succeeding month until said mortgage is paid. Notes
